Home > external > kegg > getKEGGModelForOrganism.m

getKEGGModelForOrganism

PURPOSE

getKEGGModelForOrganism

SYNOPSIS

function model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,outDir,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioG,minScoreRatioKO,maxPhylDist,nSequences,seqIdentity)

DESCRIPTION 

 getKEGGModelForOrganism
   Reconstructs a genome-scale metabolic model based on protein homology to the
   orthologies in KEGG

   organismID          three or four letter abbreviation of the organism (as
                       used in KEGG). If not available, use a closely related
                       species. This is used for determing the
                       phylogenetic distance. Use 'eukaryotes' or
                       'prokaryotes' to get a model for the whole domain.
                       Only applicable if fastaFile is empty, i.e. no
                       homology search should be performed
   fastaFile           a FASTA file that contains the protein sequences of
                       the organism for which to reconstruct a model (opt,
                       if no FASTA file is supplied then a model is
                       reconstructed based only on the organism
                       abbreviation. This option ignores all settings except for
                       keepUndefinedStoich, keepIncomplete and keepGeneral)
   dataDir             directory for which to retrieve the input data.
                       Should contain a combination of these sub-folders:
                       -dataDir\keggdb
                           The KEGG database files used in 1a (see below).
                       -dataDir\fasta
                           The multi-FASTA files generated in 1b (see below)
                       -dataDir\aligned
                           The aligned FASTA files as generated in 2a (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\hmms
                           The hidden Markov models as generated in 2b or
                           downloaded from BioMet Toolbox (see below)
                       The final directory in dataDir should be styled as
                       proXXX_keggYY or eukXXX_keggYY, indicating whether
                       the HMMs were trained on pro- or eukaryotic sequences,
                       using a sequence similarity threshold of XXX %,
                       fitting the KEGG version YY. E.g. euk100_kegg82.
                       (opt, see note about fastaFile. Note that in order
                       to rebuild the KEGG model from a database dump, as
                       opposed to using the version supplied with RAVEN,
                       you would still need to supply this)
   outDir              directory to save the results from the quering of
                       the hidden Markov models. The output is specific
                       for the input sequences and the settings used. It
                       is stored in this manner so that the function can
                       continue if interrupted or if it should run in
                       parallel. Be careful not to leave output files
                       from different organisms or runs with different
                       settings in the same folder. They will not be
                       overwritten (opt, default is a temporary dir where
                       all *.out files are deleted before and after doing
                       the reconstruction)
   keepUndefinedStoich include reactions in the form n A <=> n+1 A. These
                       will be dealt with as two separate metabolites
                       (opt, default true)
   keepIncomplete      include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear" (opt,
                       default true)
   keepGeneral         include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "general reaction". These are reactions on the form
                       "an aldehyde <=> an alcohol", and are therefore
                       unsuited for modelling purposes. Note that not all
                       reactions have this type of annotation, and the
                       script will therefore not be able to remove all
                       such reactions (opt, default false)
   cutOff              significans score from HMMer needed to assign genes
                       to a KO (opt, default 10^-50)
   minScoreRatioG      a gene is only assigned to KOs for which the score
                       is >=log(score)/log(best score) for that gene.
                       This is to prevent that a gene which clearly belongs
                       to one KO is assigned also to KOs with much lower
                       scores (opt, default 0.8 (lower is less strict))
   minScoreRatioKO     ignore genes in a KO if their score is
                       <log(score)/log(best score in KO). This is to
                       "prune" KOs which have many genes and where some
                       are clearly a better fit
                       (opt, default 0.3 (lower is less strict))
   maxPhylDist         -1: only use sequences from the same domain
                       (Prokaryota, Eukaryota)
                       other (positive) value: only use sequences for
                       organisms where the phylogenetic distance is at
                       the most this large (as calculated in getPhylDist)
                       (opt, default Inf, which means that all sequences will
                       be used)
   nSequences          for each KO, use up to this many sequences from
                       the most closely related species. This is mainly to
                       speed up the alignment process for KOs with very
                       many genes. This subsampling is performed before
                       running CD-HIT (opt, default inf)
   seqIdentity         sequence identity threshold in CD-HIT, referred as
                       "global sequence identity" in CD-HIT User's Guide.
                       The only possible options are 1 (100 %), 0.9 (90 %)
                       and 0.5 (50 %). If other values are provided, CD-HIT
                       is skipped (opt, default -1, i.e. CD-HIT is skipped)

   model               the reconstructed model

   PLEASE READ THIS: The input to this function can be confusing, because
   it is intended to be run in parallel on a cluster or in multiple sessions.
   It therefore saves a lot of intermediate results to storage. This also
   serves the purpose of not having to do redundant calculations. This,
   however, comes with the disadvantage of somewhat trickier handling.
   This is what this function does:

   1a. Loads files from a local KEGG FTP dump and constructs a general
       RAVEN model representing the metabolic network. KEGG FTP access
       requires a <a href="matlab: web('http://www.bioinformatics.jp/en/keggftp.html')">license</a>.
   1b. Generates FASTA files from the KEGG FTP dump (see 1a). One
       multi-FASTA file for each KO in KEGG is generated. Make sure you
       actually need these first, as the parsing is time-consuming (see below).

   These steps only have to be re-done every time KEGG updates their
   database (or rather when the updates are large enough to warrant
   rerunning this part). Many user would probably never use this feature.

   2a. Does alignment of the multi-FASTA files for future use. This uses the
       settings "useEvDist" and "nSequences" to control which sequences
       should be used for constructing Hidden Markov models (HMMs), and
       later for matching your sequences to.
   2b. Trains hidden Markov models using HMMer for each of the aligned
       FASTA files.

   The most common alternatives here would be to use sequences from only
   eukaryotes, only prokaryotes or all sequences in KEGG. As explained in
   the README.md file, various sets of pre-trained hidden Markov models are
   available at <a href="matlab: web('http://biomet-toolbox.chalmers.se/index.php?page=downtools-raven')">BioMet Toolbox</a>.
   This is normally the most convenient way, but if you would like to use,
   for example, only fungal sequences for training the HMMs then you need
   to run this part.

   3a. Queries the HMMs with sequences for the organism you are making a
       model for. This step uses both the output from step 1a and from 2b.
   3b. Constructs a model based on the fit to the HMMs and the chosen
       parameters.

   These steps are specific to the organism for which you are reconstructing
   the model.

   In principle the function looks at which output that is already available
   and runs only the parts that are required for step 3. This means
   that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
   RAVEN\external\kegg directory
   -1b is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   OR multi-FASTA files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this
   step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead
   (see above). If not all files exist it will try to find
   the KEGG database files in dataDir.
   -2a is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped
   if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -2b is only performed if not all required HMMs exist in the defined
   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA files or
   HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
   -3b is always performed.

   Usage: model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,outDir,...
    keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioG,...
    minScoreRatioKO,maxPhylDist,nSequences,seqIdentity)

   Eduard Kerkhoven, 2017-12-28

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG
  • getPhylDist getPhylDist
This function is called by:

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function files=listFiles(directory)

0168     fastaFile=[];
0169 end
0170 if nargin<3
0171     dataDir=[];
0172 end
0173 if nargin<4
0174     outDir=[];
0175 end
0176 if isempty(outDir)
0177     outDir=tempdir;
0178     %Delete all *.out files if any exist
0179     delete(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0180 end
0181 if nargin<5
0182     keepUndefinedStoich=true;
0183 end
0184 if nargin<6
0185     keepIncomplete=true;
0186 end
0187 if nargin<7
0188     keepGeneral=false;
0189 end
0190 if nargin<8
0191     cutOff=10^-50;
0192 end
0193 if nargin<9
0194     minScoreRatioG=0.8;
0195 end
0196 if nargin<10
0197     minScoreRatioKO=0.3;
0198 end
0199 if nargin<11
0200     maxPhylDist=inf; %Include all sequences for each reaction
0201 end
0202 if nargin<12
0203     nSequences=inf; %Include all sequences for each reaction
0204 end
0205 if nargin<13
0206     seqIdentity=-1; %CD-HIT is not used in the pipeline
0207 end
0208 
0209 % Run the external binaries multi-threaded to use all logical cores assigned to MATLAB.
0210 cores = evalc('feature(''numcores'')');
0211 cores = strsplit(cores, 'MATLAB was assigned: ');
0212 cores = regexp(cores{2},'^\d*','match');
0213 cores = cores{1};
0214 
0215 % Checking if dataDir is consistent. It must point to pre-trained HMMs set,
0216 % compatible with the the current RAVEN version.
0217 % The user may have the required zip file already in working directory or
0218 % have it extracted. If the zip file and directory is not here, it is
0219 % downloaded from BioMet ToolBox 2.0 server.
0220 if ~isempty(dataDir)
0221     hmmOptions={'euk100_kegg82'; ...
0222         'euk90_kegg82'; ...
0223         'euk50_kegg82'; ...
0224         'prok100_kegg82'; ...
0225         'prok90_kegg82'; ...
0226         'prok50_kegg82'};
0227     if all(cellfun(@isempty,regexp(dataDir,strcat(hmmOptions,'$')))) % Check if dataDir ends with any of the hmmOptions
0228         EM='Pre-trained HMMs set is not recognised. It should match any of the following sets (which are available to download):';
0229         disp(EM);
0230         disp(hmmOptions);
0231         return;
0232     end;
0233     if exist(dataDir,'dir')
0234         fprintf('Provided dataDir is in correct format for this RAVEN version in order to use pre-trained HMMs...\n')
0235     elseif ~exist(dataDir,'dir') && exist([dataDir,'.zip'],'file')
0236         fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0237         unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0238     else
0239         fprintf('Downloading HMMs archive file...\n');
0240         websave([dataDir,'.zip'],['http://biomet-toolbox.chalmers.se/tools/downloadable/files/',dataDir,'.zip']);
0241         fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0242         unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0243     end;
0244 end;
0245 
0246 %Check if the fasta-file contains '/' or'\'. If not then it's probably just
0247 %a file name. It is then merged with the current folder
0248 if any(fastaFile)
0249     if ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'\')) && ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'/'))
0250         fastaFile=fullfile(pwd,fastaFile);
0251     end
0252     %Create the required sub-folders in dataDir if they dont exist
0253     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),'dir')
0254         mkdir(dataDir,'keggdb');
0255     end
0256     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'),'dir')
0257         mkdir(dataDir,'fasta');
0258     end
0259     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned'),'dir')
0260         mkdir(dataDir,'aligned');
0261     end
0262     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms'),'dir')
0263         mkdir(dataDir,'hmms');
0264     end
0265     if ~exist(outDir,'dir')
0266         mkdir(outDir);
0267     end
0268 end
0269 
0270 %First generate the full KEGG model. The dataDir mustn't be supplied as
0271 %there is also an internal RAVEN version available
0272 if any(dataDir)
0273     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0274 else
0275     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG([],keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0276 end
0277 fprintf('Completed generation of KEGG model\n');
0278 model.id=organismID;
0279 model.c=zeros(numel(model.rxns),1);
0280 
0281 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then just remove all genes which are not for
0282 %the given organism ID
0283 if isempty(fastaFile)
0284     if ismember(organismID,{'eukaryotes','prokaryotes'})
0285         phylDists=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0286         if strcmp(organismID,'eukaryotes')
0287             proxyid='hsa'; %Use H. sapiens here
0288         else
0289             proxyid='eco'; %Use E. coli here
0290         end
0291         [~, phylDistId]=ismember(proxyid,phylDists.ids);
0292         idsToKeep=phylDists.ids(~isinf(phylDists.distMat(phylDistId,:)));
0293         taxIDs=cellfun(@(x) x{1},cellfun(@(x) strsplit(x,':'),model.genes,'UniformOutput',false),'UniformOutput',false);
0294         I=ismember(upper(taxIDs),upper(idsToKeep));
0295     else
0296         % KEGG organism IDs may have three or four letters
0297         organismID=strcat(organismID,':');   %Add colon for accurate matching
0298         if length(organismID)==4
0299             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:4),organismID),model.genes);
0300         elseif length(organismID)==5
0301             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:5),organismID),model.genes);
0302         end
0303     end
0304     %Remove those genes
0305     model.genes=model.genes(I);
0306     model.rxnGeneMat=model.rxnGeneMat(:,I);
0307 end
0308 
0309 %First remove all reactions without genes
0310 hasGenes=any(model.rxnGeneMat,2);
0311 model=removeReactions(model,~hasGenes,true);
0312 
0313 %Clean gene names
0314 for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0315     %First get rid of the prefix organism id
0316     model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(strfind(model.genes{i},':')+1:end);
0317     %Find and remove the description in parentheses if any
0318     s=strfind(model.genes{i},'(');
0319     if any(s)
0320         model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(1:s-1);
0321     end
0322 end
0323 
0324 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then we're done here
0325 if isempty(fastaFile)
0326     %Create grRules
0327     model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0328     model.grRules(:)={''};
0329     %Add the gene associations as 'or'
0330     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0331         %Find the involved genes
0332         I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
0333         model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
0334         for j=2:numel(I)
0335             model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
0336         end
0337         model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
0338     end
0339     return;
0340 end
0341 
0342 %Trim the genes so that they only contain information that can be matched
0343 %to the KEGG file of protein sequences (remove all information after first
0344 %parenthesis)
0345 %NOTE: For some reason the organism abbreviation should be in lower case in
0346 %this database. Fix this here
0347 for i=1:numel(KOModel.genes)
0348     parIndex=strfind(KOModel.genes{i},'(');
0349     if any(parIndex)
0350        KOModel.genes{i}=KOModel.genes{i}(1:parIndex-1);
0351     end
0352     colIndex=strfind(KOModel.genes{i},':');
0353     KOModel.genes{i}=[lower(KOModel.genes{i}(1:colIndex-1)) KOModel.genes{i}(colIndex:end)];
0354 end
0355 
0356 %Create a phylogenetic distance structure
0357 phylDistStruct=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0358 [~, phylDistId]=ismember(model.id,phylDistStruct.ids);
0359 fprintf('Completed creation of phylogenetic distance matrix\n');
0360 
0361 %Calculate the real maximal distance now. An abitary large number of 1000 is
0362 %used for the "all in kingdom" or "all sequences" options. This is a bit
0363 %inconvenient way to do it, but it's to make it fit with some older code
0364 if isinf(maxPhylDist) || maxPhylDist==-1
0365     maxPhylDist=1000;
0366 end
0367 
0368 %Get the KO ids for which files have been generated. Maybe not the neatest
0369 %way..
0370 fastaFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta','*.fa'));
0371 alignedFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.fa'));
0372 alignedWorking=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.faw'));
0373 hmmFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','*.hmm'));
0374 outFiles=listFiles(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0375 
0376 %Check if multi-FASTA files should be generated. This should only be
0377 %performed if there are IDs in the KOModel structure that haven't been
0378 %parsed yet
0379 missingFASTA=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[fastaFiles;alignedFiles;hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0380 
0381 if ~isempty(missingFASTA)
0382     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),'file')
0383         EM=fprintf(['The file ''genes.pep'' cannot be located at ' strrep(dataDir,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP.\n']);
0384         dispEM(EM);
0385     end
0386     %Only construct models for KOs which don't have files already
0387     fastaModel=removeReactions(KOModel,setdiff(KOModel.rxns,missingFASTA),true,true);
0388     %Permute the order of the KOs in the model so that constructMultiFasta
0389     %can be run on several processors at once
0390     fastaModel=permuteModel(fastaModel,randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(fastaModel.rxns)),'rxns');
0391     constructMultiFasta(fastaModel,fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'));
0392 end
0393 fprintf('Completed generation of multi-FASTA files\n');
0394 
0395 %Get the directory for RAVEN Toolbox. This is to get the path to the third
0396 %party software used
0397 [ST, I]=dbstack('-completenames');
0398 ravenPath=fileparts(fileparts(fileparts(ST(I).file)));
0399 
0400 if isunix
0401     if ismac
0402         binEnd='.mac';
0403     else
0404         binEnd='';
0405     end
0406 elseif ispc
0407     binEnd='';
0408 else
0409     EM='Unknown OS, exiting.';
0410     disp(EM);
0411     return
0412 end
0413 
0414 %Check if alignment of FASTA files should be performed
0415 missingAligned=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[alignedFiles;hmmFiles;alignedWorking;outFiles]);
0416 if ~isempty(missingAligned)
0417     missingAligned=missingAligned(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingAligned)));
0418     %Align all sequences using MAFFT
0419     for i=1:numel(missingAligned)
0420         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0421         %parallell process. The faw-files are saved as temporary files to
0422         %keppt track of which files are being worked on
0423         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'file') && ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0424             %Check that the multi-FASTA file exists. It should do so since
0425             %we are saving empty files as well. Print a warning and
0426             %continue if not.
0427             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0428                 EM=['WARNING: The multi-FASTA file for ' missingAligned{i} ' does not exist'];
0429                 dispEM(EM,false);
0430                 continue;
0431             end
0432 
0433             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0434             %file and continue
0435             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0436             if s.bytes<=0
0437                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'w');
0438                 fclose(fid);
0439                 continue;
0440             end
0441 
0442             %Create an empty file to prevent other threads to start to work on the same alignment
0443             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'w');
0444             fclose(fid);
0445 
0446             %First load the FASTA file, then select up to nSequences sequences
0447             %of the most closely related species, apply any constraints from
0448             %maxPhylDist, and save it as a temporary file, and create the
0449             %model from that
0450 
0451             fastaStruct=fastaread(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0452             phylDist=inf(numel(fastaStruct),1);
0453             for j=1:numel(fastaStruct)
0454                 %Get the organism abbreviation
0455                 index=strfind(fastaStruct(j).Header,':');
0456                 if any(index)
0457                     abbrev=fastaStruct(j).Header(1:index(1)-1);
0458                     [~, index]=ismember(abbrev,phylDistStruct.ids);
0459                     if any(index)
0460                         phylDist(j)=phylDistStruct.distMat(index(1),phylDistId);
0461                     end
0462                 end
0463             end
0464 
0465             %Inf means that it should not be included
0466             phylDist(phylDist>maxPhylDist)=[];
0467 
0468             %Sort based on phylDist
0469             [~, order]=sort(phylDist);
0470 
0471             %Save the first nSequences hits to a temporary FASTA file
0472             if nSequences<=numel(fastaStruct)
0473                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order(1:nSequences));
0474             else
0475                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order);
0476             end
0477 
0478             %Do the alignment if there are more than one sequences,
0479             %otherwise just save the sequence (or an empty file)
0480             if numel(fastaStruct)>1
0481                 if (seqIdentity==1 || seqIdentity==0.9 || seqIdentity==0.5)
0482                     if ~ispc
0483                         if seqIdentity==1
0484                             cdhitInp100=tempname;
0485                             fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0486                             tmpFile=tempname;
0487                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 1.0 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0488                             if status~=0
0489                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0490                                 dispEM(EM);
0491                             end
0492                             %Remove the old tempfile
0493                             if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0494                                 delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0495                             end
0496                         elseif seqIdentity==0.9
0497                             cdhitInp100=tempname;
0498                             fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0499                             cdhitInp90=tempname;
0500                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0501                             if status~=0
0502                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0503                                 dispEM(EM);
0504                             end
0505                             %Remove the old tempfile
0506                             if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0507                                 delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0508                             end
0509                             tmpFile=tempname;
0510                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.9 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0511                             if status~=0
0512                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0513                                 dispEM(EM);
0514                             end
0515                             %Remove the old tempfile
0516                             if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0517                                 delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0518                             end
0519                         elseif seqIdentity==0.5
0520                             cdhitInp100=tempname;
0521                             fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0522                             cdhitInp90=tempname;
0523                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0524                             if status~=0
0525                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0526                                 dispEM(EM);
0527                             end
0528                             %Remove the old tempfile
0529                             if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0530                                 delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0531                             end
0532                             cdhitInp50=tempname;
0533                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' cdhitInp50 '" -c 0.9 -s 0.8 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0534                             if status~=0
0535                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0536                                 dispEM(EM);
0537                             end
0538                             %Remove the old tempfile
0539                             if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0540                                 delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0541                             end
0542                             tmpFile=tempname;
0543                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' cores '" -i "' cdhitInp50 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.5 -s 0.8 -n 3 -M 2000']);
0544                             if status~=0
0545                                 EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0546                                 dispEM(EM);
0547                             end
0548                             %Remove the old tempfile
0549                             if exist(cdhitInp50, 'file')
0550                                 delete([cdhitInp50 '*']);
0551                             end
0552                         end
0553                     else
0554                         % CD-HIT is not available in Windows so we just
0555                         % export multifasta file into temporary file;
0556                         tmpFile=tempname;
0557                         fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0558                     end
0559                 else
0560                     tmpFile=tempname;
0561                     fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0562                 end
0563                 %Do the alignment for this file
0564                 if ~ispc
0565                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305',['mafft' binEnd]) '" --auto --thread "' cores '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0566                 else
0567                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305','mafft.bat') '" --auto --thread "' cores '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0568                 end
0569                 if status~=0
0570                     EM=['Error when performing alignment of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0571                     dispEM(EM);
0572                 end
0573                 %Remove the old tempfile
0574                 if exist(tmpFile, 'file')
0575                    delete([tmpFile '*']);
0576                 end
0577             else
0578                 %If there is only one sequence then it's not possible to do a
0579                 %multiple alignment. Just print the sequence instead. An
0580                 %empty file was written previously so that doesn't have to
0581                 %be dealt with
0582                 if numel(fastaStruct)==1
0583                     fastawrite(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fastaStruct);
0584                 end
0585             end
0586             %Move the temporary file to the real one
0587             movefile(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'f');
0588         end
0589     end
0590 end
0591 
0592 if ~ispc
0593     if (seqIdentity==1 || seqIdentity==0.9 || seqIdentity==0.5)
0594         fprintf('Completed clustering and multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0595     else
0596         fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences. Protein clustering was not requested or incorrect seqIdentity value was used\n');
0597     end
0598 else
0599     if (seqIdentity==1 || seqIdentity==0.9 || seqIdentity==0.5)
0600         fprintf('Protein clustering was skipped, since CD-HIT is not compatible with Windows');
0601     end
0602     fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0603 end
0604 
0605 %Check if training of Hidden Markov models should be performed
0606 missingHMMs=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0607 if ~isempty(missingHMMs)
0608     missingHMMs=missingHMMs(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingHMMs)));
0609 
0610     %Train models for all missing KOs
0611     for i=1:numel(missingHMMs)
0612         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0613         %parallell process
0614         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'file') && ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'file')
0615             %Check that the aligned FASTA file exists. It could be that it
0616             %is still being worked on by some other instance of the
0617             %program (the .faw file should then exist). This should not
0618             %happen on a single computer. I don't throw an error, because
0619             %it should finalize the ones it can.
0620             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']),'file')
0621                 EM=['The aligned FASTA file for ' missingHMMs{i} ' does not exist'];
0622                 dispEM(EM,false);
0623                 continue;
0624             end
0625 
0626             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0627             %file and continue
0628             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']));
0629             if s.bytes<=0
0630                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'w');
0631                 fclose(fid);
0632                 continue;
0633             end
0634             %Create a temporary file to indicate that it is working on the
0635             %KO. This is because hmmbuild cannot overwrite existing files.
0636             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'w');
0637             fclose(fid);
0638 
0639             %Create HMM
0640             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmbuild' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' cores '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']) '"']);
0641             if status~=0
0642                 EM=['Error when training HMM for ' missingHMMs{i} ':\n' output];
0643                 dispEM(EM);
0644             end
0645 
0646             %Delete the temporary file
0647             delete(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']));
0648         end
0649     end
0650 end
0651 fprintf('Completed generation of HMMs\n');
0652 
0653 %Check which new .out files that should be generated
0654 %Check if training of Hidden Markov models should be performed
0655 missingOUT=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,outFiles);
0656 if ~isempty(missingOUT)
0657     missingOUT=missingOUT(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingOUT)));
0658     for i=1:numel(missingOUT)
0659         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0660         %parallell process
0661         if ~exist(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'file')
0662             %Check that the HMM file exists. It should do so since
0663             %we are saving empty files as well. Print a warning and
0664             %continue if not.
0665             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']),'file')
0666                 EM=['The HMM file for ' missingOUT{i} ' does not exist'];
0667                 dispEM(EM,false);
0668                 continue;
0669             end
0670 
0671             %Save an empty file to prevent several threads working on the
0672             %same file
0673             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0674             fclose(fid);
0675 
0676             %If the HMM file is empty then save an out file and continue
0677             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']));
0678             if s.bytes<=0
0679                 continue;
0680             end
0681 
0682             %Check each gene in the input file against this model
0683             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmsearch' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' cores '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fastaFile '"']);
0684             if status~=0
0685                 EM=['Error when querying HMM for ' missingOUT{i} ':\n' output];
0686                 dispEM(EM);
0687             end
0688 
0689             %Save the output to a file
0690             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0691             fwrite(fid,output);
0692             fclose(fid);
0693         end
0694     end
0695 end
0696 fprintf('Completed matching to HMMs\n');
0697 
0698 %***Begin retrieving the output and putting together the resulting model
0699 
0700 %Retrieve matched genes from the HMMs
0701 koGeneMat=zeros(numel(KOModel.rxns),3000); %Make room for 3000 genes
0702 genes=cell(3000,1);
0703 %Store the best score for a gene in a hash list (since I will be searching
0704 %many times)
0705 hTable = java.util.Hashtable;
0706 
0707 geneCounter=0;
0708 for i=1:numel(KOModel.rxns)
0709     if exist(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']), 'file')
0710         fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']),'r');
0711         beginMatches=false;
0712         while 1
0713             %Get the next line
0714             tline = fgetl(fid);
0715 
0716             %Abort at end of file
0717             if ~ischar(tline)
0718                 break;
0719             end
0720 
0721             if and(beginMatches,strcmp(tline,'  ------ inclusion threshold ------'))
0722                 break;
0723             end
0724 
0725             if beginMatches==false
0726                 %This is how the listing of matches begins
0727                 if any(strfind(tline,'E-value '))
0728                     %Read one more line that is only padding
0729                     tline = fgetl(fid);
0730                     beginMatches=true;
0731                 end
0732             else
0733                 %If matches should be read
0734                 if ~strcmp(tline,'   [No hits detected that satisfy reporting thresholds]') && ~isempty(tline)
0735                     elements=regexp(tline,' ','split');
0736                     elements=elements(cellfun(@any,elements));
0737 
0738                     %Check if the match is below the treshhold
0739                     score=str2num(elements{1});
0740                     gene=elements{9};
0741                     if score<=cutOff
0742                         %If the score is exactly 0, change it to a very
0743                         %small value to avoid NaN
0744                         if score==0
0745                            score=10^-250;
0746                         end
0747                         %Check if the gene is added already and, is so, get
0748                         %the best score for it
0749                         I=hTable.get(gene);
0750                         if any(I)
0751                             koGeneMat(i,I)=score;
0752                         else
0753                             geneCounter=geneCounter+1;
0754                             %The gene was not present yet so add it
0755                             hTable.put(gene,geneCounter);
0756                             genes{geneCounter}=gene;
0757                             koGeneMat(i,geneCounter)=score;
0758                         end
0759                     end
0760                 else
0761                     break;
0762                 end
0763             end
0764         end
0765         fclose(fid);
0766     end
0767 end
0768 koGeneMat=koGeneMat(:,1:geneCounter);
0769 
0770 %Remove the genes for each KO that are below minScoreRatioKO.
0771 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,1)
0772     J=find(koGeneMat(i,:));
0773     if any(J)
0774         koGeneMat(i,J(log(koGeneMat(i,J))/log(min(koGeneMat(i,J)))<minScoreRatioKO))=0;
0775     end
0776 end
0777 
0778 %Remove the KOs for each gene that are below minScoreRatioG
0779 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,2)
0780     J=find(koGeneMat(:,i));
0781     if any(J)
0782         koGeneMat(J(log(koGeneMat(J,i))/log(min(koGeneMat(J,i)))<minScoreRatioG),i)=0;
0783     end
0784 end
0785 
0786 %Create the new model
0787 model.genes=genes(1:geneCounter);
0788 model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0789 model.grRules(:)={''};
0790 model.rxnGeneMat=sparse(numel(model.rxns),numel(model.genes));
0791 
0792 %Loop through the reactions and add the corresponding genes
0793 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0794     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
0795         %Get all KOs
0796         I=find(strcmpi(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name,'kegg.orthology'));
0797         KOs=model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I);
0798         %Find the KOs and the corresponding genes
0799         J=ismember(KOModel.rxns,KOs);
0800         [~, K]=find(koGeneMat(J,:));
0801 
0802         if any(K)
0803             model.rxnGeneMat(i,K)=1;
0804             %Also delete KOs for which no genes were found. If no genes at all
0805             %were matched to the reaction it will be deleted later
0806             L=sum(koGeneMat(J,:),2)==0;
0807             model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I(L))=[];
0808             model.rxnMiriams{i}.name(I(L))=[];
0809         end
0810     end
0811 end
0812 
0813 %Find and delete all reactions without any genes. This also removes genes
0814 %that are not used (which could happen because minScoreRatioG and
0815 %minScoreRatioKO)
0816 I=sum(model.rxnGeneMat,2)==0;
0817 model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
0818 
0819 %Add the gene associations as 'or'
0820 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0821     %Find the involved genes
0822     I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
0823     model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
0824     for j=2:numel(I)
0825         model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
0826     end
0827     model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
0828 end
0829 end
0830 
0831 %Supporter function to list the files in a directory and return them as a
0832 %cell array
0833 function files=listFiles(directory)
0834     temp=dir(directory);
0835     files=cell(numel(temp),1);
0836     for i=1:numel(temp)
0837         files{i}=temp(i,1).name;
0838     end
0839     files=strrep(files,'.fa','');
0840     files=strrep(files,'.hmm','');
0841     files=strrep(files,'.out','');
0842     files=strrep(files,'.faw','');
0843 end
